page.title: 11A DIPTFORD FARMERS DAY
page.content: The farmer gets up at six o'clock, he gets the{cows}in and puts them in the yard. After checking the machinery he lets the cows in and some of them step on to the platforms. The farmer cleans the udders, so the milk does not get dirty. Then the farmer puts on the milking clusters. The milk goes from the cow into a glass jar. When the glass jar fills up it goes into a cooler. Later a tanker will come and tke the milk away. After milking the farmer has his breakfast, then he clears the slurry into a pit and then feeds the calves. He fertilises his land to grow good grass. Then he goes and checks the {sheep.} He mends broken fences and hedges. After lunch he does odd jobs like mending broken machinery and prehaps {crops} spraying untill it gets dark. Then home to bed.
